metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14404 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference vulnerability exists in the xpath.c:xmlXPathCompOpEval() function of libxml2 through 2.9.8 when parsing an invalid XPath expression in the XPATH_OP_AND or XPATH_OP_OR case. Applications processing untrusted XSL format inputs with the use of the libxml2 library may be vulnerable to a denial of service attack due to a crash of the application.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14404` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13
libxml2-utils - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13
python-libxml2 - 2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu4.13').
